awd_titl_txt: MathTools for Teachers, 4-6:  A Staff Development Program   for Grade Teachers
awd_abstract_narration: This three-year project will produce a series of staff development              seminars and teachers enhancement materials for teachers in                     grades four through six.  Building on the successful "MathTools for             Teachers K-3" project at the University of Chicago, the staff will              design teacher enhancement materials to develop the connections                 between the mathematical structures of arithmetic and geometry                  and the school curriculum.  Mathematical applications will be                   emphasized.  Exemplar student problem sets will be developed and                introduced to teachers through the materials.  A series of                      workshops for staff development leaders will serve as pilot sites               for the implementation of the seminar.  An evaluation of the                    effectiveness of the seminars is included in the project plan.                                                                                                  Cost sharing is provided by the University of Chicago, the Amoco                Foundation, the Ford Motor Company, local school districts, and                 COMAP as 66% of the NSF award.
org_div_long_name: Division of Research on Learning in Formal and Informal Settings (DRL)
